meanings.definition: Train (an animal) to defecate and urinate in a designated place.
meanings.sent1: She patiently housebreaks her new puppy to use the pee pad.
meanings.sent2: It takes time to housebreak a young dog to go outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was funny to housebreak the parrot to use the litter box.
meanings.sent4: The zookeeper housebreaks the baby elephant to use a specific corner of the enclosure.
meanings.sent5: Housebreaking a pet requires consistency and positive reinforcement.

meanings.definition: To enter a building unlawfully in order to commit a crime.
meanings.sent1: Criminals sometimes housebreak into homes to steal valuables.
meanings.sent2: The burglars planned to housebreak into the bank after midnight.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie showed a clumsy thief trying to housebreak into a bakery.
meanings.sent4: The idea of someone trying to housebreak into a police station is absurd.
meanings.sent5: The detective caught the suspect red-handed while trying to housebreak into the museum.
